name: River Pines Resort
description: Tucked into the towering pines of the northern Sierra Nevada, River Pines Resort offers a standout retreat for families, couples, and outdoor lovers. A family-owned haven for over 40 years — with new ownership keeping its soul intact — this charming destination blends cozy lodging, thoughtful amenities, and mountain-side adventure under one roof. Wake up refreshed in compact cabins, well-appointed rooms, or spacious suites with kitchenettes — all designed to match your comfort needs.
shortDescription: Family-owned mountain resort in Graeagle with cabins, pool, hot tub, and The Roadhouse dining next door.

faqs.question: What type of accommodations does River Pines offer?
faqs.answer: Rustic lodge rooms and cabins nestled in the pines along the Feather River in Graeagle. A genuine mountain retreat with a relaxed, casual atmosphere.

faqs.question: Does River Pines have dining?
faqs.answer: Yes — the on-site restaurant and bar is a popular gathering spot for locals and visitors, featuring American comfort food and cocktails.

faqs.question: What golf courses are nearby?
faqs.answer: Graeagle Meadows and Plumas Pines are both minutes away. Additional courses include Whitehawk Ranch and Nakoma Dragon. Golf the High Sierra builds custom packages — call 888-584-8232.

contentParagraphs: Tucked into the towering pines of the northern Sierra Nevada, River Pines Resort is a scenic, full-service mountain retreat spanning 17 acres in the heart of Plumas County. Nestled along the Middle Fork of the Feather River, the resort features 44 comfortable rooms and 18 charming cabins — a family-owned haven for over 40 years with new ownership since March 2024 keeping its soul intact while making exciting upgrades.

Wake up refreshed in compact cabins, well-appointed rooms, or spacious suites with kitchenettes — all with brand-new mattresses and refreshed interiors. Enjoy your morning coffee by the fireplace in the cozy lodge, or dip into the large outdoor pool followed by a soak in the in-ground hot tub. Shuffleboard, ping-pong, horseshoes, a puzzle table, complimentary library, and a game lounge add even more ways to unwind.

River Pines isn't just about comfort — it's about connection. Outdoor enthusiasts can cast a line in the nearby Feather River, tee off at world-class courses like Plumas Pines and Graeagle Meadows, trek bike trails through Plumas-Eureka State Park, or explore local boutiques and galleries in the charming village of Graeagle. When hunger strikes, head next door to the newly remodeled Roadhouse Restaurant for hearty meals, refreshing cocktails, and indoor-outdoor dining — or grab a drink at the outdoor pool bar.
